Module: Helpers

Collection of general purpose REGEX strings and methods not being related to SOAP or SONOS.
Since:
  • 2020-11-08
Author:
  • Henning Klages
Source:
  • Helper.js, line 3

Methods

(static) discoverSonosPlayerBySerial(node, serialNumber, callback)

Starts async discovery of SONOS player and returns ipAddress - used in callback.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
node object current node
serialNumber string player serial number
callback function function with parameter err, ipAddress provides ipAddress or null (not found) and calls callback handling that.
Source:
  • Helper.js, line 45

(static) failure(node, msg, error, functionNameopt)

Show any error occurring during processing of messages in the node status and create node error.
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
node object current node
msg object current msg
error object standard node.js or created with new Error ('')

 name of calling function

(static) isOnOff(msg, propertyName, propertyMeaning, packageName) → {boolean}

Validates property and returns true|false if on|off (NOT case sensitive).
Parameters:
Name Type Description
msg object Node-RED message
Properties
Name Type Description
propertyName string item, to be validated
propertyName string property name
propertyMeaning string additional information, including in error message
packageName string package name, included in error message
Source:
  • Helper.js, line 214
Throws:
if msg[propertyName] is missing, not string, not on|off (NOT case sensitive)
Type
error
Returns:
true/false if msg.property is "on/off" ! not case sensitive
Type

(static) isTruthy(input) → {boolean}

Validates whether an const/variable is "valid". Empty string allowed! Empty object/array allowed. NOT allowed: undefined or null or NaN or Infinite.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
input object | array | number | string | boolean const, variable
Source:
  • Helper.js, line 399
Throws:
nothing
Returns:
false: let input; let input = null; let input = undefined; let input = NaN; false: let input = 1.0 divide by 0; let input = -1.0 divide 0 true: let input = '', let input = {}, let input = [], let input = true
Type
boolean

(static) stringValidRegex(msg, propertyName, regex, propertyMeaning, packageName, defaultValueopt)

Validates msg[propertyName] against regex and returns that value or a default value. If defaultValue is NOT given then msg[propertyName] is required! Throws error if missing. If defaultValue is given then msg[propertyName] is not required and default value is only used in case msg[propertyName] is not "isValidProperty" (undefined, null, NaN). The defaultValue is not used in case of wrong type, not in range. defaultValue should be in range min max (not checked).
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
msg object Node-RED message
Properties
Name Type Description
propertyName string item, to be validated - maximum 3 digits
propertyName string property name
regex string expression to evaluate string
propertyMeaning string additional information, including in error message
packageName string package name, included in error message
defaultValue string <optional>
 specifies the default value. If missing property is required.
Source:
  • Helper.js, line 328
Throws:
  • if msg[propertyName] is missing and defaultValue is undefined
    Type
    error
  • msg[propertyName] is not of type string
    Type
    error
  • if msg[propertyName] has invalid regex
    Type
    error

(static) success(node, msg, functionName)

Set node status and send message.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
node object current node
msg object current msg (maybe null)
functionName string name of calling function
Source:
  • Helper.js, line 196

(static) validateConvertToInteger(msg, propertyName, min, max, propertyMeaning, packageName, defaultValueopt)

Validates and converts msg[propertyName] to number (integer). If defaultValue is NOT given then msg[propertyName] is required! Throws error if missing. If defaultValue is given then msg[propertyName] is not required and default value is only used in case msg[propertyName] is not "isValidProperty" (undefined, null, NaN). The defaultValue is not used in case of wrong type, not in range. defaultValue should be in range min max (not checked).
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
msg object Node-RED message
Properties
Name Type Description
propertyName string | number item, to be validated, converted
propertyName string property name
min number minimum
max number maximum, max > min
propertyMeaning string additional information, including in error message
packageName string package name, included in error message
defaultValue number <optional>
 integer, specifies the default value.
Source:
  • Helper.js, line 253
Throws:
  • if msg[propertyName] is missing and defaultValue is undefined
    Type
    error
  • msg[propertyName] is not of type string, number
    Type
    error
  • min,max,defaultValue not of type number, max <= min
    Type
    error
